choices.F: Remove the world read/execute privilege from the accounting directory.
choices.D: Remove world read privileges from the public_key.pem file.
choices.A: Remove group read/write privileges from the private_key.pem file.
choices.C: Change the group ownership of the mysql directory to the mysql user group.
choices.E: Change the parent directory owner and group to mysql.
choices.B: Remove world read privileges from the server-cert.pem certificate file.

discussion.content: BD, remove world privs, so people can see or mess with it. The answers given seem random.

Selected Answer: D
Agreed - Answer D.

Selected Answer: D
VERIFY_IDENTITY: Like VERIFY_CA, but additionally perform host name identity verification by checking the host name the client uses for connecting to the server against the identity in the certificate that the server sends to the client

questions.question_text:
You must configure the MySQL command-line client to provide the highest level of trust and security when connecting to a remote MySQL Server.
Which value of --ssl-mode will do this?

comments.content: B is not guarantied, innodb use general space won't free up. E might be the other right answer.
AD. B is not always going to free up space if the innodb tables use general tablespace. For check, there is a read lock.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
Analyze table does not execute --auto-repair

questions.question_text:
You are using mysqlcheck for server maintenance.
Which two statements are true? (Choose two.)

choices.E: The mysqlcheck --analyze --all-databases command performs a series of checks to spot eventual table corruptions.
choices.C: The mysqlcheck --repair --all-databases command can repair an InnoDB corrupted table.
choices.B: The mysqlcheck --optimize --all-databases command reclaims free space from table files.
choices.A: The mysqlcheck --check --all-databases command takes table write locks while performing a series of checks.
choices.D: The mysqlcheck command can be renamed mysqlrepair so that it repairs tables by default.

Which three features are available with this installation method? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
I think C, D and F/A?
https://dev.mysql.com/doc/mysql-monitor/8.0/en/mem-component-overview.html
https://dev.mysql.com/doc/mysql-monitor/8.0/en/dashboard-overview-graphs.html

choices.G: disk usage and disk characteristics including disk advisors warnings

choices.A: Take a physical backup of the MySQL system.
choices.B: Use the Clone Plugin to copy the data to another MySQL system.
choices.D: Take your backup from a slave of the MySQL system.
choices.C: Take a logical backup of the MySQL system.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
MyISAM is locked during mysqldump. Thus, C can't be due to requirement of "can never be locked to the client application"
B or D, but clone has limitations, so D

questions.question_text:
You have a MySQL system with 500 GB of data that needs frequent backups.
You use a mix of MyISAM and InnoDB storage engines for your data.
Examine your backup requirement:
The MySQL system being backed up can never be unavailable or locked to the client applications.
The recovery from the backup must work on any system.
Only 1 hour of data can be lost on recovery of the backup.
Which option fulfills all backup requirements?
